website_summaries.verdict: A good basic card reader from Anker capable of reading a variety of memory card formats.
pros: Dual card slots are capable of reading a variety of SD, MMC, and UHS-I memory cards
You can read and write two cards at the same time
Works with most computers without the need for additional drivers
cons: Some memory cards read and write slower than others on the device

customer_reviews.title: Great Product but Laptop users be aware.....
customer_reviews.text: Works great :) I bought Anker because I trust Anker. Product works as described. Only complaint I have is that if you are using this on a laptop, where the USB ports are right next to eachother, you are not able to use the port next to it. I attached a picture. I had to unplug the USB item next to it in order to plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Reader, Fast speeds through USB 3.0
customer_reviews.text: Great Card Reader, Fast speeds. If anyone else would like me to do further testing please comment. I use this card for all my Micro SD and SD Cards and it transfers great with USB 3.0. I've gotten remarkable results with this and the Lexar 1000x SD Card for my camera. If you want full speeds for your card without a reader as a bottleneck, definitely go with this one and it's at a budget price. Big fan of Anker Customer support as well as they have replaced a charger from me nearly 16 months later from a previous purchase. OS: Windows 10 CPU: Intel i7 4790K GPU: EVGA GTX 970 SSC Ram: 16GB Corsair Dominator Platinum 2333
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey T.

customer_reviews.title: worked only for 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: It only worked for 5 minutes. I was browsing stuff on my micro sd card when explorer window disappeared. I unplugged card reader and it was pretty hot. Then I tried using it on my laptop it didn't work and I got "usb device power surge" notifications, so that's that... fortunately micro sd card survived.
customer_reviews.author: tengo

customer_reviews.title: Constantly disconnects while in use
customer_reviews.text: This is while using this reader with a Surface Pro 4 I turned off power management but it doesn't make a difference. Within a short period of time, once the reader with both slots loaded I get to tone alert that this device has disconnected. I receive a pop-up stating that Windows has stopped this device because it has reported problems. (Code 43) A USB port reset request failed. No support.
customer_reviews.author: TeacherMac

customer_reviews.title: Quit after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this adapter but after 3 months the MicroSD slot stopped recognizing cards. That is what I purchased it for so now it is useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin 805

customer_reviews.title: For $10 what do you have to lose? Well, $10
customer_reviews.text: It rarely connects at USB 3.0 speeds, 95% of the time it transfers at USB 2.0 speed. I finally figured out that if I push it into the USB port REALLY HARD then it will transfer at 3.0 speed... most of the time. I don’t feel like damaging my computer’s USB port so I will probably get a different one. I’m an Anker fanboy and I use several of their battery products, but I wish I passed on this especially since it’s not returnable.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Never worked!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned and (partially) used this reader for just under two years now. The MicroSD reader work great, however when reading a full size SD the drive comes up as “write protected” regardless of the position of the SD’s physical slide lock. I always assumed it was a faulty SD card or there was something wrong with my computer’s permissions. I now have tried this with several cards and on 4 diffrent PCs. It’s the reader! It never worked! And now, I’m beyond the 18-month warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Peralta

customer_reviews.title: NOT DESIGNED FOR THIN LAPTOPS
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. This device is too thick to plug in to a thin and light laptop. You will have to lift up the laptop to insert it.Putting the laptop back down while it's plugged in could damage the laptop. They could've designed this so the USB insert is closer to the bottom. Instead it is right in the middle of it. This is a major design flaw in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: H. B

customer_reviews.title: Stop working within 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: Just use it once and when I try to use it again today to transfer my Christmas pictures. My PC can’t recognize it anymore. Tried using my other 2 PC’s same thing happen. To my disappointment I toss it to the trash on Christmas Day. 👎👎👎
customer_reviews.author: PreciousDad808

customer_reviews.title: Will not allow read-write access to SD Cards
customer_reviews.text: Received this reader yesterday as a replacement for the cheap one that came with my camera. When I put an SD card into it, it will only allow the card to mount as read-only. The card is fine, I can use it in my camera and have read-write access to it with my other card reader, so it appears to be an issue with this reader. Not thrilled with the fact I can't return it - that wasn't anywhere on the page when I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Williams

customer_reviews.title: There are clearly better options.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, there are better options on Amazon especially for card readers that are built out of aluminum and have a separate cable. There is simply no good reason to have this reader if you value durability, as it broke after a few months of use, albeit due to user accident. The way it protrudes makes it stick out of the PC tower unnecessarily far. Mine forced the card to look backwards and read downwards as well. This may be an okay and dependable product for a laptop or casual user, but for any photographer or the likes, buy something with some structure behind it. For the same price point as others, this reader pales in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Aperture40

customer_reviews.title: Corrupted my SD cards
customer_reviews.text: Title. I cannot view my sd cards in disk management nor any of the tools in Linux. Nor the command line in Windows with chkdsk, etc. I've tried some popular softwares to try to fix this like Wondershare RecoverIt and they don't detect the SD cards. For reference, I used new, never used PNY sd cards to try to put files onto it. I also tested using this on 3 different computers. I am using a Windows 10 Machine. Maybe it'll work for others, but on mine, I've lost 10 dollars essentially (excluding this purchase). I rated it 2 stars out of generosity. Unfortunate, because I have been happy with their other products.
customer_reviews.author: Sid

customer_reviews.title: Insure your card is included in the listing of acceptable cards.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I was unable to use this device because it does not accept the card I have, an Sm (Smart Media) card. This is no reflexion on the Anker 2-in-1 reader. Sadly, I did not check thoroughly the cards listed as readable, (which were clearly listed by Amazon in their listing of the product). This product does seem to be a likely 1st class choice to buy within its card category, based on packaging and product appearance. For someone needing a reader for a card it reads, I would recommend buying the card.
customer_reviews.author: Bingham972

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised in a Tesla Model 3
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use in my 2020 Tesla Model 3 for the purpose of Sentry Mode/Dash Cam. I paired it with a Samsung PRO Endurance 128gb/100MB/s MicroSDXC card. So far the pair is working really well.
customer_reviews.author: wrz0170

customer_reviews.title: Prompted to format
customer_reviews.text: 3/4 of the time, it would ask to format my Micro SD card ( yes used multiple Micro SD, different brands, ratings, sizes) . Did not matter the insertion order, USB port used, or even computer used. I would have to insert it several time before it would read that the card was formatted and had data on it. The SD card reader worked fine though. So, I just been using an SD card adapter for the micro SD cards. Yes , the Micro SD cards read fine on another working reader. So, I put the rating to reflect how often I could use the reader properly.
customer_reviews.author: ken walker

customer_reviews.title: A USB card reader for SD cards
customer_reviews.text: - This is a review for Anker 2-in-1 USB 3.0 SD Card Reader My Experience: It's a card reader from Anker that only takes SD card and Micro SD cards. Nothing much really to talk about here other than that it works, but it is a bit bulky. Positive: + It reads SD card and Micro SD cards Neutral: | It only reads SD card and Micro SD cards, it doesn't read other types of cards like other more expensive card readers Negative: - the unit itself is a bit bulky, it can be annoying for laptops or computers that lack many USB ports Recommended: Yes, it does what it's set out to do
customer_reviews.author: SenseiPika

customer_reviews.title: Great product at an extremely fair price
customer_reviews.text: My 4-year-old desktop's SD slot stopped working. Emailed the manufacturer about replacing the card-reader module, and got no response. Did a search on Amazon for SD card readers, and this one (their best seller) looked perfect. Ordered and got it in 2 days (Prime). Tried it with my wife's camera SD card. It not only works, it's quick. Highly recommended. Note: The body of this reader is 2.7cm wide. Because it plugs directly into a USB port, before buying it, make sure you have room around the port you intend to use it in. Anker also makes one at slightly higher cost that has a 0.4' cable to keep it well away from adjacent ports.
customer_reviews.author: DKT

customer_reviews.title: Cheap in price and in construction. Not Anker's usual quality.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a fair number of Anker products and always consider them to be a great value--good products at a fair price. While this item works just fine, it seems very cheaply made compared with Anker's usual quality. The plastic is very thin and the metal ports inside each slot (where the actual connections are) don't properly align with the slots cut into the plastic. Time will tell, but I doubt this will survive life in my laptop case.
customer_reviews.author: Quahog

customer_reviews.title: DOES THE JOB PERFECTLY - NO GIMMICKS, SOFTWARE, DRIVERS, OR INSTALLATION REQUIRED
customer_reviews.text: Simple. To the point. No gimmicks, no software to install. No drivers. It's about as plug & play as it could possibly be. If you have an available port, you can leave it plugged in. It's small enough to not get in you way. It is exactly what I wanted and it works. What's not to like?
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn ArmstrongTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last a week!
customer_reviews.text: My product didn't even last a week before the SD card part of the reader went 'Read Only', essentially making it pointless. The microsd still works but its not a port I use. I've bought Anker products before and have always been happy about the quality of their products to but see that it has gone down is pretty disheartening.
customer_reviews.author: Brighten

customer_reviews.title: Not working with NAS. Not returnable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to attach my NAS to read SD files. NAS does not read the reader. It is simply not visible on network. My other drives such USB are perfectly readable. So issue is this item not being NAS readable. Worse, although listing didn’t indicate, when I tried to return it thru my account, it was indicated that item is not returnable. It doesn’t make sense what I cannot return the item. I called Amazon, theIs excellent customer service graciously issue a refund. I really recommend avoid buying this product. Cheers.
customer_reviews.author: Hans Blix (Pol)

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, inexpensive, but slightly blocks adjacent USB ports when plugged in.
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as intended and it's very affordable. I bought 2 for my house, 1 for my laptop, and 1 for travel. It is very universal since it fits pretty much any common size memory card, and Anker is actually a reliable brand even though it's considered a "cheap aftermarket" Chinese company. I have tried at least 10 different Anker products like these, external battery packs, Bluetooth wireless speakers, cables, and other accessories, and amazingly they all work like name brand products but they are anywhere from 50% less to sometimes 90% less than the "reliable name brand" versions!
customer_reviews.author: CustomerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Lemon.  Quit working after 5 min; but Anker replaced!
customer_reviews.text: * one star for product; ***** five stars for customer service I bough this unit for it's compact size and that it had a dedicated micro SD card slot. It worked great for about 5 min. Then I heard the familiar sound of a USB device being disconnected, although I hadn't, and the light turned off. I disconnected and reconnected and even tried other ports, computers and SD cards, but nothing worked. So I contacted Anker customer support and they sent a replacement. They also apologized for the defective unit. I have bough many Anker products and I keep coming back because their customer service is determined to ensure their customers are satisfied. Thanks Anker!
customer_reviews.author: mobes

customer_reviews.title: Worked Very Good Until It Disappeared!
customer_reviews.text: First I will say that I own several Anker products and I am very satisfied with all of them. The card reader did a very good job until it was lost in a motel while traveling. I travel for work and set up office whereever I am. The reader came without a USB cap and does not have anything to attach to a lanyard so it is easy to misplace. I plan to order another and try to attach some type of retainer. Hope Anker picks up on this defiency and alters the design as most other brands provide the cap and an attachment point.
customer_reviews.author: Inspector Gadget

customer_reviews.title: This is non-refundable, does not work on a macbook unless you unplug all other ports to make it fit.
customer_reviews.text: This is non-refundable, and does not work on a macbook unless you unplug your other ports to make it fit. meaning you can't have a power cord plugged in, or if on the other side of macbook, you can't have an external monitor plugged into thunderbolt port. So if you're like me and use an external monitor, keyboard, and trackpad, now you have to unplug everything in every port just to plug in this SD Card Reader. Again this is non-returnable for some reason. I use to like this company but not anymore if I can't return products. I'm giving Uni Card Readers a try next.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Almost started fire, reader so hot it burned my hand.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware , I this reader became so hot it burned my hand when I removed it from my computer! II have had numerous card readers before this one , none have ever gotten hot . Just a heads up , buyer beware !!!!! This product is also non returnable to amazon ??? No reason given as to why it can't be returned, I just received it yesterday 2/20/2019.This reader is also not a 8 in 1 reader as stated.
customer_reviews.author: gregfish43

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is amazing (as with any Anker product). Please note that you get USB 3.0 speeds only on "Reads" and not on "Writes". The general idea being the write is done by an external system - phone/dashcam etc and you want to transfer those to your desktop/laptop. I saw a consistent read of 90MB/sec (Yes that is right uppercase MB). The four stars is because the card slots do not have the spring action so you will have no idea whether they seated properly. For the price, I will definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Anu

customer_reviews.title: Works great provided someone doesn't misplace it and a cat doesn't steal it.
customer_reviews.text: Like other Anker products I found this works great. My one issue I ran into is I live with someone who like to clean up and move things around in the process. She often has no idea what things are used for lol. If you find yourself such a situation I suggest pulling up a picture on Amazon to show your person so they can make a visual id. Unfortunately mine has gone missing so perhaps it was eaten by a feline. I even have an electronics organization case to keep such things in but you know cats are clever. Seriously though it worked great good download speeds etc. I used it with a Microsoft Surface 7 to proof images.
customer_reviews.author: Curt B.

customer_reviews.title: No Joke - SUPER User Friendly
customer_reviews.text: This memory card reader is exactly what I needed. Something lightweight that fits easily in any bag or even my pocket. Reads cards super fast and is literally plug-and-play. I was looking at more expensive units thinking there must be something up with the low price of this unit but I'm glad I went with this buy. The only real different you won't see with this unit vs others is the USB-C ability but if that's what you are needing then you obviously wouldn't be looking for something as mobile and convenient as this. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Jake Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working on 2nd attempt.
customer_reviews.text: Being used on a Win10 pc. The pictures were scanned from the memory card but would not download to the computer. I sell on Ebay, so I take lots of pictures and needed a reader that worked every time. I tried many different processes but could not get it to work. I wound up ordering another brand/style card reader that downloads much faster & has worked every single time I have used it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Ditto

customer_reviews.title: Simple device that simply works...
customer_reviews.text: It grabs two drive letters when you plug it in, one for each card slot so you can easily copy from regular SD card to micro SD and vice versa. Slots are on the right side and are back-to-back, with the reader label-side up the full-size SD card will be upside down when inserted. Also has an activity light. Inexpensive but well-made. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good USB card reader to carry
customer_reviews.text: This is very good USB card reader to carry around. I wish they would have some protection for the usb part. I'm worried that it might move around inside a back and might just bend or snap. Also it does great job reading big capacity memory cards and does good job transferring at USB 3.0 speed.
customer_reviews.author: BenKaTop Contributor: Clarinets

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome and Flawless! Update: I don't recommend nor endorse this... Buckle Up! Don't ever think about trying this at home! SFX : Head Slap on forehead.. D'uh! The unit survived a 28 minute wash cycle.. detergent, color safe clean in cold tap water.. medium speed rinse.. forgot it was in my pocket.. WOW! Gave it 48 hours to completely dry out.. I admit that I'm much more careful than this.. plugged in an old sd micro card into my cell.. it worked without a hiccup. I'll admit that it's nice and clean..LOL.. Built to endure acts of stupidity... Thanks Anker!
customer_reviews.author: Amazing PuddyTat

customer_reviews.title: Micro card went all the way in - like it FELL IN
customer_reviews.text: I still don't know for sure if this was human error, but I've been using disks of various sizes for decades. I put in the micro SD card in the reader and the computer did not find it. Hesitantly, I slowly pushed the card into the reader a bit further wondering how I would be able to get it back out, and BAM, it was gone. I shook the reader and could hear the card rattling around in there. What a stressful morning. Thankfully my husband was able to demolish the reader and retrieve the card.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work in a USB hub chain.
customer_reviews.text: I originally rated this 1 star because it didn't appear to work under Linux. However, it appears that this device *does* work - as long as you don't use it in a USB3 "chain", e.g. plugged into hub that is chained from another hub that is plugged into the computer. I unchained the last hub containing the reader and plugged it directly into the computer, and the reader works.
customer_reviews.author: Burton H Janz

customer_reviews.title: great product for moving files
customer_reviews.text: plugs in well at usb port. flash ssd's seat well within the unit. files move from anywhere to anywhere as advertised. great bang for the buck. i have other ankar products and have not been displeased and do not expect to be so with this unit. one note: it is best to 'eject' this unit from the device, like laptop for instance, then move the ssd cards around rather that trying to insert cards into the ankar while it is plugged in. fyi, since the usb connection is exposed all the time this seriously should come with a protective cap and when i run across one i shall employ it but that does not change this from being 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This adapter worked straight out of the box without any issues on my Windows 10 laptop. I bought it for the SanDisk Ultra 64GB microSD card* I use in my camera, and it reads and writes to the card without any problems. It has two slots, one for regular SD cards, and one for microSD cards. I tried both slots, and had no problems. *My laptop has a card reader slot, but the buggy EXFAT driver in Windows 10 keeps blue-screening my system when I write to the card. With this adapter, the card is seen as a USB hard drive, so the EXFAT driver isn't used. Problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Skyles

customer_reviews.title: very good USB to SD card reader.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Reads/writes SD cards connected to a USB device - computer, iPhone with adapter. The only improvement I would recommend is to have the SD card slot perpendicular to the USB connector making it easier to remove/insert a SD Card. Also would allow it to work better with the iPhone USB adapter. currently the SD card faces the power (lightning port) connector which getrs in the way of the SD. I woudl definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce R.

customer_reviews.title: received broken item
customer_reviews.text: I was excited when I saw that Anker offers this card reader but I'm very disappointed that my card reader didn't even work. I've always purchased Anker items in the past and have always had a good experience. I was expecting the same quality for this reader. Item is non-returnable too.
customer_reviews.author: S. Tang

customer_reviews.title: USB 3.0 is a must!
customer_reviews.text: There's not much to say about this item. It does what it's supposed to do, and it does it well. Getting the USB 3.0 version was definitely a good move; the speed is much better than USB 2.x. If you're like me, and you live dangerously by not politely "ejecting" your USB media before you disconnect it, you'll be happy to know that you can also hot swap the memory cards while the card reader is still inserted. I'm sure I'll corrupt some data doing this at some point or another, but on my deathbed, I'll know that I didn't waste my life ejecting, disconnecting, swapping memory cards, and reconnecting this device.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: microchip disappeared inside card reader-- can't get it out.
customer_reviews.text: This was working fine for awhile, but today I put in the microchip and it went in further that usual. Tried to pull it out but it disappeared inside the reader and no way to retrieve it unless I break the reader. I would like my money back.
customer_reviews.author: dragonfly

customer_reviews.title: Card Reader
customer_reviews.text: * Item number: B006T9B6R2 * Item title: Anker 8-in-1 USB 3.0 Portable Card Reader for SDXC, SDHC, SD, MMC, RS-MMC, Micro SDXC, Micro SD, Micro SDHC Card and UHS-I Cards This is a very handy item to have, You can read your SD card (both sizes) directly to your computer. I found it easy to use and open files but have not yet edited. However, with ease to open and locate files, I am sure editing will be just as easy.
customer_reviews.author: G1095

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: After loosing my laptop to water damage, I needed a solid way to transfer my pictures from my DSLR camera to my computer for processing. This little job did just the trick. Not only does it have a slot for a standard SD card, but it also has a slot for a microSD card as well, meaning I don't have to find that stupid up-sizing adapter everything I want to pull something off my dash cam! No drivers to install, no annoying software. Plug and play, no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin M

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: The micro sd slot stopped working the first time I used it. I was trying to copy the content of a smaller capacity micro sd card onto a bigger one and my Windows computer started telling me that there was no drive in the device. It's not the card. The computer recognizes the card when I use the adapter for a regular sized sd card in the bigger slot and the card works fine in my tablet. So it's obviously a problem with the reader. What a waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little wonky when using for SDHC
customer_reviews.text: My two SDHC cards almost don't want to fit into the slot and you have to be pretty careful about not touching the reader or the disk when using it. Also, the transfer was a little slow, but it was able to get data off of an SDHC disk that was starting to go bad, so I can't complain too much. I bought Anker because their charger and cords have been sturdy and I'm glad I did -- after two bad SDHC card reader purchases, this was a welcome change.
customer_reviews.author: S K Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great device, but a little bulky.
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I'm on the road a lot and I need to transfer data from SD and Micro SD cards to my laptop. Pros: - Relatively fast - Can transfer from 1 SD and 1 MicroSD at the same time - Relatively small. Cons: - Because it sits flush with my laptop, I cannot plug anything into the USB slots behind or in front of the device, which means when this is plugged in, it's literally the only thing I can have plugged into my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: zaise

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work; can't return.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work and "not eligible for return". I wrote the seller and have not heard back. Fortunately I only wasted $10! I will go to Best Buy to get a similar product and then I'm sure I can return the item if it doesn't work. Sometimes "brick and mortar" is better!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great value for plug-and-play SD/microSD card reader
customer_reviews.text: A simple, plug-and-play, no fuss card reader for SD and microSD sizes (the most common formats). I was considering one of the million-in-one, every-format-known-to-man card reader instead of this, but that wasn't really practical because these are the only two formats I use. No regrets on that decision so far. Pros: - Classy, simple design - USB 3.0 for higher transfer speed limit - Can read two cards simultaneously (mounts as two individual cards) - LED status light - Low cost Cons: - Only two formats, but at least they are the most common - No cap or retractable USB plug - Orientation for inserting cards is not labeled - microSD cards can be challenging to insert
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: my current favorite media reader
customer_reviews.text: I run an IT department for a small business, and we use SD cards to a ton of things, from security cameras, to DSLRs project management uses for bidding, Raspberry Pi, etc etc. this reader has so far done the best job of being cheap, small, fast, plugnplay and just generally a pleasure to use. Most of our offices have one of these permanently stuck in the side monitor hub ports. great little things.
customer_reviews.author: Erik A. Berger

customer_reviews.title: Shorts, loses contact w/PCs
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this adapter as it makes it easy to run a "sneaker net" and swap cards between devices and PCs. My first one outright failed in 3 months, but I figured with 3000 reviews and lots of stars, it must have been an anomaly. My second one, about a year old, is now unreliable and unpredictably loses contact with my PCs (and regains it, and loses it, and regains it...). I use different PCs, a variety of USB ports, etc. so it's in the Anker adapter. YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. White

customer_reviews.title: Very Short Lived
customer_reviews.text: I bought this reader in October 2017 after reading many favorable reviews and also due to it being relatively inexpensive. It worked fabulously for a year and a half but then suddenly stopped working. Windows Explorer still recognized it but then would crash and upon re-launching Explorer, the reader was not even there. So it's junk. I will not waste money on another one. I need a reliable SD card reader that will last me a few years. ANKER is not one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Otto Stewart

customer_reviews.title: The write speed is terrible and it's not the memory sd card either.
customer_reviews.text: Writing to the HC sd card is horribly slow. I thought it was my MacBook so I used my son's new laptop to write the raspberry pi image. No still crazy slow. I tried another HC sd card and its the same story. After looking I found the Dane Elec sd card adapter and that writes 3 times faster. I think I am going to return this as I feel it could be bad. I have other Anker products and they all work well but this one is a serious dud.
customer_reviews.author: Jason_in_Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Failed after a week of heavy use
customer_reviews.text: I have been plugging and unplugging full size SD cards quite a bit for about a week. Today, the reader started reporting that the read-only switch was set on every card I insert. This is a mechanical failure inside the reader, making it useless. Update I bought 2 of these. The second one failed about a week after the first one in the same way. This would appear to be a design defect. Anker support reached out but was unable to resolve the problem. They issued a prompt refund. I will still buy Anker products, but not this one!
customer_reviews.author: Clay Weston

customer_reviews.title: Looks solid and works fast
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Samsung 512GB MicroSDXC card to use in my Surface Pro 2 to replace the old card, and was faced with copying over 320 gigs of data from my primary Dell PC. This card reader worked to perfection and the whole load was copied in less than 3 hours to the Samsung, and the new card is now in the Surface working well with all my data available. If I never used the Anker again it has already paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Anker is well-known for well built and stand behind their product warranty
customer_reviews.text: Reads and writes on microSD cards as well as Standard SD cards. Mac and PC both compatible. very well built. blinks light when in use. lights stays on when its connects to computer. I had purchased generic one from ebay years ago which no longer able to read any new cards so i choose anker as they are reputable company. Anker can update firmware if newer cards cannot read. for this reason i brought anker card reader. Customer service is not notch. I have contacted to Anker and representative Ada solve my problem quickly. thank you Anker. Thank you Ada.
customer_reviews.author: Satyam

customer_reviews.title: Truly Impressive
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased a Lenovo E14 ThinkPad that does not have an SD reader. So like any other Amazon Shopper, I searched for and found this little device. Having had a variety of Anker products, I purchased without question. Well, it arrived and I inserted a 512GB SD card and a 256GB MicroSD card. Impressive; the little device recognizes two (2) drives and Windows identified them without issue. This little device is worth it's weight in gold.
customer_reviews.author: Luca Caprice

customer_reviews.title: repeatedly disconnects from pc.
customer_reviews.text: not worth a penny. It disconnects every time I try to use it. I would not recommend. Further, the seller has this listed as a battery. So when you attempt to return a defective product, the refund is not available. Steer clear.
customer_reviews.author: Jophi

customer_reviews.title: Updated: Works fine, plus Anker is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Original review: Mine does NOT read a 64GB MicroSDXC UHS-I card. It reads the same card fine in a SD-sized adapter, and it reads a 4GB MicroSD card just fine, but nothing comes up with the larger card. Amendment: Anker contacted me and sent me another (slightly different) card reader to try. The MicroSDXC card did work in that adapter. I then formatted it, after which it also worked in this adapter. So everything seems to be all right, though it is peculiar that it didn't work at first (especially since this particular card worked fine in my DJI Phantom 3, and in a SD-to-microSD adapter).
customer_reviews.author: E. Lofgren

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: I usually love Anker products. This thing, though, ate my microSD (it literally fell into the body when I inserted it), and didn't recognize a full-size SD card (it *was* recognized when I used the built-in card reader on the PC, so not an issue with the card). Anker support was as helpful as they could be, issuing an RMA for refund and noting that I had permission to pry off the top to retrieve my microSD.
customer_reviews.author: Coinneach Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: I am always impressed by this brand
customer_reviews.text: If you have a usb 3 or newer and a memory card that can take advantage of the full speed buy this. Fast simple and easy to use. Plug in the card and to a usb 3.0 port and it worked great. I looked at several different types of these but the reviews hardly ever state how they were using these to get these speeds. I am getting between 85-95 MB/s reads and 75-80MB/s writes on a samsung evo U3 select 256/512 gb cards consistently on self created 4k 60fps hdr vid files (larger files the faster the continuous data transfer speeds). Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My card reader in my Mac doesn't work all the time, so I ordered this external card reader, and I'm thrilled with it. It fits in the USB port and works for 2 sized cards. I have a small card in my Intova camera (underwater camera) and this works great with it. My Cannon uses as regular sized card and it also works with that too. I love that I can use both sizes in this one, small, convenient card reader. Easy peasy! Yay!
customer_reviews.author: Reggae Dancer

customer_reviews.title: A necessity for me
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned a SD card or micro SD card until about a week ago when I purchased one for my drone. I was surprised to see that my computer had 12 USB ports, and not a single SD card reader or micro SD card reader! This adapter works great, its fast, built well, and has an SD and micro SD card slot on it. I am very happy with this product, ANKER has continued to give me good products that work very well at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Another winner from Anker.
customer_reviews.text: I swapped my 15" laptop (with built-in SD card reader) for a 13" notebook with USB-C ports. My Nikon D500 uses XQD and SD cards, so I had to purchase an SD reader and continue to use my XQD reader to import images on the road. (The USB-C ports aren't a problem--I have a USB-C to USB-A adapter.) I have always found Anker products to be well-made, reliable and a good value, so buying this was a no-brainer. I haven't been disappointed: downloading large image files goes smoothly and quickly. The reader is small and seems well-built. Highly recommended. (The micro-SD slot is a bonus, although I don't anticipate using it often.)
customer_reviews.author: NikonEsque

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Data Transfer Device
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased the card reader I wasn't sure if I would like it but it is slightly bigger than a normal USB thumb drive. But after using it for a few weeks, I love it. I tested it with a Samsung SD card and I can transfer 2.1Gig files from my hard drive to this device (via a 3.0 USB) hub at 70Mbs. It look less than 50 seconds to move my file. I use it for putting movies on it to watch on my Smart TV and laptop. It is fast and I can change out the SD card very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Tony S

customer_reviews.title: Compact and fast
customer_reviews.text: These compact SD card readers work excellent at USB 3.0 speeds! I actually got 2 of them thinking I could run solid state storage on a TPlink 5400 router. In PC and laptops I don't see the conflict, but in a TP link wireless router, they conflicted each other. The USB identifier firmware cannot ID them as separate devices. They are all addressed the same on the USB Buss. This is why this got the 4 stars due to the manufacturer limitation. Otherwise, a great stand alone product!
customer_reviews.author: MartianRabbit

customer_reviews.title: This item cannot be returned if you don't like it.
customer_reviews.text: The usb 3.0 card reader is nice and works, but has a little slack when you put the card in while it is attached to the computers usb port on the front or back. I feel that over time if you use this product daily it will soon cause a problem with the usb ports and they are connected to the motherboard on my systems. I tried to return them, but they don't accept returns, therefore, beware of this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, but it works
customer_reviews.text: I got this card reader because the built-in SD card reader for our computer stopped working. I'd thrown away our old card reader because I figured I'd no longer need it. Since SD cards are the only ones I use a card reader is a necessity. I'm pleased with this one since it does the job. As long as it doesn't get lost (which would be easy to do since it's so small) it should be very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Dickson

customer_reviews.title: 8-in-1? How does that work?
customer_reviews.text: Anker makes solid gear and this is a nice little device. That said, how do they get away with calling it 8-in-1? The device has a microSD slot and an SD slot. That's it. Even their own marketing blurb only lists 6 variations on those two hardware formats and a 7th that requires an adapter that isn't included. So, yeah, this thing will do a good job of reading your SD and microSD cards but, honestly, that's it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Heinz

customer_reviews.title: hoping to transfer pics from phone to laptop
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to transfer a large number of photos from my phone to my laptop. It froze over and over, would start working again, then finally completely froze after transferring only 14 percent of my data. I might try again later, but pretty disappointed. I did transfer both small and large folders but the performance was the same; freeze/stick, work for another few images, freeze. Then finally I had to shut down my laptop to remove it because it's not listed on task manager and I just gave up since it had been stuck/frozen for over 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Little thick
customer_reviews.text: This USB Card reader is okay; nothing special. One thing to take into consideration: if you're planning on using this with your SLIM/THIN laptop, make sure to look at the dimension as that this unit is sort of "thick". It could be thick enough to prevent some thin laptops from lying flat on its bottom.
customer_reviews.author: JParkSD

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly. Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to update my car's navigation and multimedia software from the OEM SD card.. The software download and SD card update utility only runs on Windows but my Macbook's SD card reader is not accessible to VMWare virtual machines, so I needed a USB external card reader. This card reader from Anker worked perfectly with the Mac and Windows 10 on VMWare. I am also happy with the build quality: I intend to throw it in a drawer and am confident it will still work when needed again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Tom H

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and Easy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend because he uses both a GoPro and my Nikon P900 often. His computer’s memory card port requires a tweezers to get the cards out and this was driving him crazy. He uses a micro SD and a normal SD for his projects. He specifically wanted a USB 3.0. This works really well for him and it is super convenient for me since we tend to share camera cords and he was constantly snagging my tweezers.
customer_reviews.author: Tzi

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Card Reader
customer_reviews.text: I needed a faster way to transfer images from my Nikon d5600 to my laptop. Plugging in my laptop via USB took too long to transfer files over, so I figured that a SD card reader would be the way to go. Since I buy from Anker for my phone cables, chargers, and battery packs, I decided to get this one. With this, I can keep it in my camera bag whenever I need to transfer files. It's very convenient since it'll be hard for me to lose it that way. The transferring speeds are also noticeably faster, so I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Vertrees

customer_reviews.title: Should of bought this earlier
customer_reviews.text: I made the switch to an iPhone from Samsung and I sorely missed the screen mirror feature that my Samung provided to mirror my phone to watch movies on my Samsung TV. I even bought an Apple TV to screen mirror my phone but it was WAY too laggy and unwatchable. I then bought this little device for 10 bucks and plugged it to my TV to watch my movies downloaded to my Micro SD card and it works flawlessy and smoothly. Should of got this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Same great quality as I with other Anker products
customer_reviews.text: Simple. Windows downloaded and the driver and that was it. It read the SDXC card that I had been unable to read before with my old reader (another brand). I really like Anker products, if I’m looking for electronics and there is an Amker product listed, that’s what I will buy. No, I do not work for Anker or Amazon, and I do not get paid to write glowing reviews of products.
customer_reviews.author: ToldYouSo

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Fast for the Size and Price
customer_reviews.text: This card reader is surprisingly fast. I have a larger and more expensive Kingston reader that stays connected to my desktop and got this as a portable option. Because of its size and price I didn't expect the fastest speeds, and was pleasantly surprised when I found that it was capable of maxing out my Samsung EVO Select micro SDs. I don't have any faster at the moment to test it with, but knowing it can do 70-80mbps is already above my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Garcia

customer_reviews.title: A replacement for my single USB reader.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my single slide in micro usb sd card reader, which gets hot and it is a pita to remove the sd card. This works great for both sd card types I use. The down side (probably because it is a dual card reader) is that my phone can not read the sd card. It will read my old one, so guess I am stuck with it for phone use. This one will be used for my desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Billyk

customer_reviews.title: Greatness is in simplicity
customer_reviews.text: I don't SD card fast enough to find where this SD card really bottlenecks :D I have UHC class II SD card on my DSLR, and it has full potential of 60 MB/s read and about 40 MB/s write, which is great! Much greater than a built-in SD card reader in laptops. I also just LOVE the packaging! No scissors needed, it just shuts sturdily, so you can re-use it for other flash drives.
customer_reviews.author: Mergen Alimaganbetov

customer_reviews.title: Essential tech piece
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased my new laptop, I didn't notice that it didn't have a SD port, just a USB drive. This is a perfect solution. It's small and portable which is perfect when using a laptop. It's also easy to remove so you can easily switch between USB devices. Plus, it's easy to store without taking up lots of space. My computer had no problems recognizing the device and I was able to upload all of my data within and reasonable time.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Not so fast
customer_reviews.text: I tested this using Crystal Disk Mark and a fast microSD card. The first test showed it was about half the speed of my trusty Transcend unit. I then tested this card in my Transcend device, then in this Anker again. The second test with this unit showed improvement, but it's still about 30% slower than the Transcend. For the price difference, I think I'll return it.
customer_reviews.author: Lunix

customer_reviews.title: Great USB 3 card reader - fast.
customer_reviews.text: I work at a university in tech and I buy a lot of stuff like this for our video editing rooms. I bought this unit for my self at home since I shoot a lot of GoPro footage and transferring the files to my editing system takes forever with USB 2.0. All the cards have gotten way faster than USB 2.0 so it was time to upgrade my card reader. I love Anker products and own a few other Anker things. Great brand.
customer_reviews.author: eng_steve

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: This item started to malfunction as of day 1, overheats, disconnects, unrecognizable by ports( checked multiple PC and ports). Unfortunately I was traveling and unable to return it. I don't remember if I purchased the asurion protection but I will definitely not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amanuel Haile

customer_reviews.title: Look No Further
customer_reviews.text: If you need a reader with these specs. look not further. I uses this reader with a 400gb Sandisk microsd card for music, and videos in my car. It plays flawlessly. Works in the computer flawlessly when transferring or deleting files. Here's where it gets good. I accidentally left in my pocket and washed it with the microsd card in it. Took it out, plugged it in and it fired up perfectly!! Amazing! I just knew I lost both. nope! They are both emphatically approved by Dad!!
customer_reviews.author: LeShane L

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The item works great, no issues. The speed is as expected and the built quality is accessible. Be aware that if you use it with the Apple USB 3 camera adapter for iPhone / iPad you will need to connect a charger or it wouldn’t power up.
customer_reviews.author: C. Christov

customer_reviews.title: Worked one time, then failed
customer_reviews.text: Blinking blue light, no connection, no drive recognized in Windows. Other readers work fine in same USB slot. Sadly, past the return window. Fortunately, it was only twelve bucks. Disappointed, as Anker has generally produced good reliable gear. Not this time.
customer_reviews.author: P. Land

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says at a very fair price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little SD reader. It is compact and feels very sturdy. I have only used it for SD cards but I have transferred several thousand files and it has worked perfectly. The reader was immediately recognized on 2 different Windows 10 computers. I have not tested the actual speed but I can say it is much faster than an older reader I was using. I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Shantastic

customer_reviews.title: a fine SD reader
customer_reviews.text: the unit works as it was portrayed. Its about the size of a postage stamp and 1/2 and works fine with either the SD or SD micro. very compact and easy to use. Just an update, used it for the first time to due a large download from my SD camera card. It downloaded 13.3 gig of pictures through a usb2 port in 11 minutes. very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: It’s small but it works!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to move some pics off an old tablet and phone with a micro sd card. Works fine. It’s a small thing, maybe a bit smaller in length than a business card and about 1/2 inch thick. Looks to be well made, attractive little gadget. Has an indicator led on it to let you know it’s connected. Your computer reads it as an external connection, select it as you would by other usb connection. Wish it came with some sort of storage bag though.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Nelxon

customer_reviews.title: Dual card use
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good item to use. There's been a few times where I've had to fiddle with at a couple times or so over the course of the time I've had it, but hey. This is great if you need to get footage off a micro sd card and regular sized sd card at the same time and you don't have a built in sd card slot on your device or computer, it utilizes your USB port instead.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Russman

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else. It's a $10 non-returnable plastic trinket.
customer_reviews.text: My PC won't recognize any SD cards I use with the adapter. I tried multiple SD cards and verified they were recognized and worked normally on other devices. There were no driver updates available on the Anker site and Windows can't find any driver updates either. I also installed the most recent Windows updates to no avail. I've generally had good luck with Anker products but this was a let down.
customer_reviews.author: nateprokrasti

customer_reviews.title: A plug & play necessity
customer_reviews.text: The Anker 8-in-1 USB card reader is truly a plug and play necessity. If you do any work with memory cards whether you're a photographer, videographer or musician this is the device for you. Memory cards fit in nicely and Windows 10 automatically recognizes this device as a passthrough which means you're up and running instantly viewing the contents of your memory cards. Personally I use this device for flashing raspberry Pi images and it is much faster than my old clunky device. Well worth the asking price but even better on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Gazrok

customer_reviews.title: Great, fast card reader!
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw a photo of this, I had reservations as to whether this was legit because the logo doesn't look exactly like the Anker logo. I saw that it was sold by AnkerDirect so I figured it must be legit. I plugged it in and it immediately read my card so much faster than using USB directly from the camera. My only gripe with it besides the logo is you have to plug your card in upside down.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Works without any lag. Good buy. Shipped fast without prime!
customer_reviews.text: My new laptop didn't come with an SD card slot, so I needed a reader. I ordered this. Reviews seemed solid, price was good, why not. Got the reader in just a few days (without prime and during this pandemic, wow!). I popped it in, immediately read my sd card without issue. Transferred a ton of photos from my 32bg card to my laptop quickly without lag. Works great! Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Katheryn Camm

customer_reviews.title: Best SD card reader I have ever tried (tried over10 different brands).
customer_reviews.text: The reader seems well made, I have used it with several different computers, operating systems and SD cards and it always has done the job quickly. I am a repeat buyer of this product as though they are quite robust, they have wandered from my desk on occasion (pilfered is the assumption). I highly recommend this card reader though it only fits SD and Micro SD cards (but of all speeds and types I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: MicroSD does not have a stop
customer_reviews.text: I spent more to try this because it was Anker but was disappointed. The MicroSD does not have a stop to prevent it from going in too far. I pushed my MicroSD in too deep (I know, fat fingers) and spent time unburying it by picking it out with tweezers. Plus, this product is too big. Going back to IOGear, even though it is only USB 2.0:  Both ports read files all right. I gave an extra star because this is Anker. I really like the brand and gave this 2 stars because of that. I have purchased several Bluetooth speakers and battery chargers...love those. Just don't recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: SD Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Small and great build.
customer_reviews.text: It works and is small yet able to take an SD card and micro SD card at the same time. However my reader will not go any faster than 45MBps all my cards are 90MBps and faster and work just fine in my laptop or a borrowed reader from a friend. Yet this reader just doesn't provide the speed it should be providing quite disappointing. Edit added: did some further research and seems something with my pc doesn't want to cooperate with this reader properly. No fault at the manufacturer but seems to work properly on newer Intel based systems.
customer_reviews.author: Shalini

customer_reviews.title: Works with Chromebook !
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to use with my camera that uses SD card. The new Chromebook doesn't have SD port only USB, HDMI, and micro SD slots. Plugged the unit in and plugged the card in and it recognized the card and there were my photos. Small and easy to use, so far I only used with SD card, so can't say much for versatility yet. No reason to believe to won't work with other cards.
customer_reviews.author: j. mckee

customer_reviews.title: Nonfunctional card reader
customer_reviews.text: This card reader did not connect with my PC thru any of the 4 USB ports. And Indicator light didnt go on. Suspicious given the great ratings. Upon return, Amazon Customer Service did not want product back despite my refund, so in my experience this thing is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As described, another purchaser's post convinced me.
customer_reviews.text: Like another post, I shoot in a RAW image which is a much larger file than other camera settings. I had no problem downloading images with this product. All this was at a great cost savings rather than replacing a USB-c port in my Canon camera.
customer_reviews.author: charlton

customer_reviews.title: I love this little thing
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says it does. It's made sturdy and honestly, I kinda loved unboxing it. It had a really nice package. It is slightly wide so put it on the opposite side of your laptop as anything else you have that is usb plugged in. Honestly though, there aren't many that aren't that wide and for what it does it is a pretty compact little thing. I love it. I'm glad I have it. Transfers the same as any usb 3.0 device so it depends on your laptop transfer rate as well as the files you're moving.
customer_reviews.author: AlaskanLost

product_meta.title: Anker 2-in-1 USB 3.0 SD Card Reader for SDXC, SDHC, SD, MMC, RS-MMC, Micro SDXC, Micro SD, Micro SDHC Card and UHS-I Cards
feature_bullets: Simultaneously read and write on two cards to save yourself the effort of constant unplugging and re-plugging.
USB 3.0 enables data transfer rates of up to 5Gbps for faster Sync times, backward compatible with USB 2.0/ 1.1.
Fully powered via your USB port — no additional power supply required.
No drivers required for Windows 10/ 8/ 7/ Vista or Mac OS X 10.2 and above.
Package contents: Anker SD/TF Card Reader, hassle-free 18-month warranty.

specifications.Operating System: Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 8, Mac OS X 10.2 Jaguar
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars11,653 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
